decks.notes: This deck focuses on generating a high amount of mana quickly through rituals and mana-producing spells, with the goal of casting a large X-cost spell like Sundering Eruption to deal massive damage to the opponent. It also includes cards like Valakut Awakening and Manamorphose for card draw and filtering, as well as Goblin Charbelcher as an alternative win condition. The deck aims to win the game through explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent with powerful spells without relying on traditional land sources.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining a aggressive game plan with efficient creatures. By combining disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push with powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Emperor of Bones, the deck aims to control the board and chip away at the opponent's life total. Additionally, the deck utilizes flicker effects like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate to generate incremental advantage and protect key creatures. Overall, the deck seeks to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy to achieve victory.

This aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while quickly developing a board presence. It utilizes cards that can remove threats from the opponent's side of the field, such as Solitude and Prismatic Ending, while also controlling their hand with Thoughtseize. The deck also includes creatures with powerful abilities like Flickerwisp and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to pressure the opponent. With a mix of disruption, removal, and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with its versatile threats.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost creatures and using disruptive spells like Fatal Push to control the opponent's board. Cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Green Sun's Zenith help to search for key threats or answers as needed. The deck also utilizes a variety of utility lands and creatures like Scavenging Ooze to provide additional advantages. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control of the battlefield to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using Goryo's Vengeance and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It makes use of instant speed spells like Ephemerate and Solitude to control the board and protect the combo. Other cards like Fallaji Archaeologist and Tainted Indulgence provide additional graveyard interaction and card advantage. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overpower the opponent before they can react.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while quickly building a board presence to overwhelm them. By utilizing cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's resources, and Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, the deck aims to apply pressure and tempo. With creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepard and Overlord of the Balemurk, the deck can quickly build a threatening board state while using cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate to protect and re-use key creatures. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while aggressively attacking to secure victory.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent through a combination of counterspells, removal, and hand disruption. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Fatal Push and Psychic Frog, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with Thoughtseize and Sauron's Ransom. The inclusion of cards like Murktide Regent and Abhorrent Oculus provide win conditions to close out the game. With a balanced mix of control elements and threats, this deck aims to outlast opponents and secure victory through attrition.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By leveraging powerful cards like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to deny the opponent resources while slowly grinding them out with efficient threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck also utilizes card draw and graveyard recursion to maintain its advantage in the late game, ultimately outlasting the opponent and securing victory through careful control and resource management.

This deck aims to quickly cycle through cards to fill up the graveyard with creatures, then cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield. The combination of cycling cards like Street Wraith and Shardless Agent, along with cascade spells like Ardent Plea and Subtlety, allows for a quick and explosive combo that can overwhelm opponents with a large number of creatures. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Force of Negation and Endurance to protect the combo and interact with opponents' strategies.

This Esper Control deck focuses on disruption and removal to control the opponent's board while utilizing card advantage and card draw to maintain a strong hand. It includes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card filtering effects to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win. The deck also incorporates a few win conditions in the form of Murktide Regent and Abhorrent Oculus to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency and support the deck's control game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing instant reanimation cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Solitude to bring powerful creatures like Griselbrand back from the graveyard to the battlefield quickly. This combo strategy is supported by spells like Faithful Mending and Ephemerate to draw cards and protect the combo pieces. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive cards like Force of Negation and Spell Snare to control the game and ensure the combo can go off smoothly. The key idea is to reanimate big threats instantly to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently ramp up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Primeval Titan, while utilizing Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate more mana. The deck aims to combo off with cards like Scapeshift or Primeval Titan to search and put into play powerful lands like Vesuva or Crumbling Vestige, allowing for explosive plays and game-winning combinations. The deck also includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Tolaria West to further enhance its combo potential and protect key spells.
